name: Carlton Dublin Airport Hotel

reviews.text: This is a nice hotel, and it seemed relatively new. We stayed in a twin room, which was about the size and quality we see at a quality hotel in the US. They provide free internet. The hotel is several miles outside of the city center, but that was no problem for us, as there are several bus lines that stop about a block away from the hotel. Actually, if you are just visiting the city, you could stay at the Carlton and forego renting a car.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.liked: — Newer hotel with quality similar to quality hotels in the US
likes.disliked: — The food was not all that good

reviews.text: We ate a couple of meals here, nothing exciting and a bit expensive. My son and I split a meal - a salad, an entree, a beer and a soda and it came to about 50 euro, and was not all that good. There are few restaurants withing easy walking distance from the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Value , Excellent Staff

likes.disliked: — in the middle of an industrial estate so not many nice views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean, beds comfortable and quiet, even though it is very near the airport. I would certainly recommend it.
reviews.title: Gorgeous

likes.disliked: — i didn't have enough time there!

reviews.text: We stayed just 1 night at the Carlton as we had arrived late into Dublin & didn't want to spend the night in the airport waiting for our connection.
reviews.title: Crappy bar food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was beautiful and very large as was the bathroom.
reviews.title: Not so good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed with the Carlton for 2 nights before a long haul flight. The hotel is less than 5 mins drive from the airport. We booked via an independent website and I had called the hotel a couple of days previous to our stay to request an upgrade. This was no problem.
reviews.title: Overall good experience

likes.liked: — The good standard of accomodation for the price paid
likes.disliked: — Prices in the bar, restaurant and for utilization of some of the amenities

reviews.title: Really nice hotel.
reviews.text: We arrived at approx 9pm at night. Check in (and check out) was quick and painless – the front desk staff were not overly friendly, but were helpful and efficient.

On entering our room we noted that there was no A/C. The room was also situated facing the road and the motor and air traffic was quite audible. We called down and were advised that they did not have a superior room with A/C, but could move us to a big room with same which they offer to show us. This room was quiet and nicely sized.
reviews.title: Close to airport, convenient to town

reviews.text: The hotel is modern and the rooms are nicely decorated with good facilities including free internet access. The beds are hard, but strangely comfortable (duvets and feather pillows) and the bathrooms are clean, spacious and equipped with the usual array of toiletries. This room also came with bathrobes and slippers. Movie channels also available, but price for this was a little on the extortionate side.
reviews.title: Great rooms for an airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the hotel on both nights for convenience sake and while the choice or quality of the food will not blow you away it was very adequate. The prices are a little on the high side.
reviews.title: Aah the noise!!

likes.liked: — The quiet part of the day

reviews.text: Just back from an overnight stay at the Carlton, and I have no problems to report.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was very spacious, well equipped and unless you have bionic hearing, you will not hear your neighbours! Breakfast next morning was great - plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Average, surprise it is a four star

reviews.text: In relation to other reviewers complaints, I think I should maybe highlight the following points...
reviews.title: comfy night
Modern, lovely looking hotel -NO AIR CONDITONING!
reviews.text: 1. Aircraft noise - em well some noise is expected, as the hotel IS located on the airport perimeter...

2. Air conditioning - well as the hotel is located in Dublin, a city not known for extremes of temperature - ac is not essential. I even managed to figure out that if I wanted to cool the room, I could do so by opening the window. Genius! I managed to struggle on regardless!!
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable european hotel

likes.liked: — The staff were very friendly and the room was so comfortable to be in.
likes.disliked: — I cannot say any negatives about the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night in the Penthouse Suite. It was a lovely big comfortable bed with a separate living room – flat screen TV’s in each. There were 2 bathrooms with a fantastic shower in each – great pressure. There was a balcony off the bedroom and the sitting room with a view of the runway. We ordered room service which was fine. The only problem we had was there was no minibar (I think the room was very new when we stayed in it – October), no pictures on the walls and the kettle had to be plugged in on the floor. Oh and our room number was 116 (I think) and there was no sign for it – it didn’t exist according to the hotel directions! Little things but when you’re paying for the best room… There was a shuttle bus to bring us to the airport at the crack of dawn the next morning, no problem at all. I would definitely stay here again – by far the best airport hotel I’ve stayed in.
reviews.title: Good Airport Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: what a lovely hotel.. we stayed on the ground floor and the room was fab.. really big and the staff were lovely... they run a shuttle bus to the airport also which is very handy i would really recommend this hotel and it is very reasonably priced
reviews.title: loved it

reviews.text: We stayed here with friends as all the cheap hotels in Dublin centre were full due to the 6 nations rugby match, it was a really good move as the hotel was a bit of class and we only paid 88 euros so i think it was quite good value really .
reviews.title: Worth The 4 Stars

reviews.text: As for Dublin itself? well i cannot see what all the fuss is about, its dull and grey and feels like a constant wet weekend to me, it has lots of bars/pubs for sure but so have most other cities across europe which are much more attractive places to visit.
reviews.title: nice one

reviews.text: just spent 2 nights at carlton lives up to its 4* good sized bedrooms, well equiped ..tea/coffee making facilities, hairdryer, iron+board.breakfast was included in price and was very good lots of choice. hotel situated outside of city centre but easy enough to get in to, local buses all go in to centre and cheap.
reviews.title: Not bad, but VERY noisy

aka: Carlton Dublin Airport Hotel County Dublin, Ireland
